description:
Drought-defying bermudagrass for southern lawns

Grow the quintessential southern lawn with our elite bermudagrass seed 2-pack.

Bermuda Time 2-pack delivers exceptional heat and drought tolerance with a deep-rooting system that thrives in full sunlight. Its thick, fine-bladed turf withstands heavy traffic while maintaining its lush appearance through southern summers. This premium bermudagrass blend helps your common bermuda lawn survive occasional cold snaps, making it perfect for larger existing lawns or new properties in warm southern regions. Establishes quickly and creates a resilient lawn that handles whatever the southern climate brings.

At Sunday, we create lawn solutions that work with nature—so you can enjoy your yard and spend less time maintaining it.

sections.whats_included: Premium Bermudagrass seed blend of common bermuda varieties, offering a total coverage up to 10,000 sq. ft. of lawn.
sections.instructions:
For best results, plant in late spring to mid-summer when temperatures are 70-90°F.
Apply at the correct rate: 1 lb. per 1,000 sq. ft. for both new lawns and overseeding
Start spreader at lowest setting and apply seed uniformly across lawn
Keep seed consistently moist until germination (7-21 days). Avoid letting seeds dry out during germination period.
sections.faq:
Helpful Tips from Lawn Advisors:
What’s the seed rate for Bermuda Time bermudagrass seed?
For maintenance seeding or overseeding: 1 lbs./1000 sq. ft.
For heavy repair, weedy lawns, and new lawns: 1 lbs./1000 sq. ft.
How long does bermudagrass seed take to grow?
Expect germination between 7-21 days with proper moisture and warm temperatures.
When to plant bermudagrass seed?
The optimal time to seed is late spring to mid-summer, when temperatures consistently range between 70 to 90 degrees Fahrenheit.
Can I use this seed on hybrid bermudagrass varieties?
No. Bermuda Time seed is only for use on common bermudagrass lawns. Hybrid bermudagrass varieties like Tifway 419 and Celebration are sterile and cannot be seeded – they must be installed as sod or plugs and can only be repaired with the same hybrid variety.
Are there any US states where this is not approved for use?
This product is only approved for use in southern states, including: AL, AR, AZ, CA, DC, DE, FL, GA, HI, KS, KY, LA, MD, MO, MS, NC, NM, NV, OK, SC, TN, TX, VA, WV
